Reviews.Title: “More like Dickens!”
Reviews.Author: VisitorFromUK186518
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location if you have an early or late Paddington connection - the reason why I booked it - but no other positives! It is four floors high and no lift. Someone helped me take my large suitcase up to 4th when I arrived, but not when I was leaving. The stairs up to third and fourth floor are Dickensian ... tiny, twisting and creaking like they would fall apart. The rooms are so tiny like a dolls house; also it was super noisy, thin walls, do not expect a quiet night. On asking to move room due to the noise from a school group which the staff tried and failed to stop, I was told there were no more rooms. On trying to leave the hotel at 11pm to find a new hotel in the neighbourhood a different staff member found me an empty ground floor, quiet large room! Also beware how you book: even if you book through this hotel's OWN website, the hotel will not deal with any complaints or requests for refunds - they will tell you it is the internet web company who deal with the booking who the customer must contact. All that was missing was Basil, Manuel and the funny side. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “"Well worth the money"!!!”
Reviews.Author: meoldmarra
Reviews.Content: Just got back home .........Booked two nights(jan 13th-15th 2012), read all the bad reviews so was a little sceptical..family of 4 in one room, with breakfast, two nights £200 !! Room was small, but big enough for what we wanted...bathroom was small, clean, plenty of good clean towels..loads of red hot water....breakfast !!? well, breakfast was fantastic.....we wernt expecting Gordon Ramsey quality,but the choice of food was fantastic,loads of toast, jams, marmalade,baskets of boiled eggs, free flowing apple and orange just.....machine coffee!!......plenty of it and more than acceptable quality !..then we had cereals...5 mins later we were presented with a red hotel plate of bacon, sausage,2 fried eggs, mushrooms, beans, tomates and toast...........thought i was full until i realised that there was some waffles coming hot out of the machine..chocolate spread !!!!!!!! the breakfast staff were more than polite and very helpfull.............All in All, for the money, this was the best value hotel i have stayed in , in 51 years TOP CLASS.....if you are intending to show your lady a romantic eveing in London, then its probably not for you........but if you need somewhere simple, close to good tube links, for you and the kids.this is it...........by comparison, three weeks ago we stayed at The Scotsman in Edinburgh.5* listed as one of the top 100 hotels in the world...so we get about a bit......but me, wife and kids had a great london base at The Sheakesphere!!!!!............dont pay simple money for plain simple hotels, then compare them to something 4 times the price..its not a fair comparison........WELL DONE to all at The Sheakesphere !!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and bad service”
Reviews.Author: CarolPD
Reviews.Content: At this hotel the beds were made by pulling up the covers and leaving the sheets rumpled at the bottom. On complaining my bed was properly made but my partner's was not. A towel that was dirty and left on the floor for replacing was refolded and replaced dirty for re-use. Cups that were used were not washed, and the tea bags left in them. If this hotel was incredibly cheap, you might put up with all this, but we were paying Euro 120 a night, and we could at least have expected a clean, well serviced room. It is a disgrace that London hotels can get away with such despicable service - and obviously don't care, as they know that there will be lots of other suckers to take the place of the one's who will never, ever stay in their hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont waste your money booking this hotel”
Reviews.Author: wearfam
Reviews.Content: We thought we were getting a good deal when we booked three nights at the Shakespeare Hotel in Norfolk Square...it seemed to have the ideal location and, from the photos, looked clean and suitable for us and our daughter. When we arrived at the reception, we were struck by how unprofessional the staff seemed..they didnt seem to know how to book guests in!. Eventually we were given a room and the receptionist even commented that we had "a good room". We were told we were in building one so off were trooped with our three cases and up two narrow flights of stairs. It was immediately obvious that the hotel was dirty and badly in need of a revamp. There were missing stair sides and the carpets were absolutely filty..it looked like someone had been sick on the landing and it wasnt properly cleaned up! Our room was a disgrace! The "furniture" looked like it was left over from just after the war when everything was made of box wood. The room had three single beds and was tiny..not help by the fact that it contained a bathroom "pod" which wasnt big enough for my husband to turn round in! I complained and was given a "bigger room" which turned out to be the same size but it had a bunk bed in. The smell of smoke was very overpowering even tho we were only in the room for a short time. After getting only rudeness and indifference from the staff, booked out and went to the Hilton round the corner. Heavenly only knows what the kitchens were like if that was the front of house!!

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful Experience”
Reviews.Author: HiltonRGB
Reviews.Content: Due to time pressure, I didn't read the other reviews before booking at this hotel, and boy, am I sorry now! All the other positives mentioned are there: situated across from tree-lined park, convenient location with Paddington station and shopping district nearby, and reasonably quick check-in. But the rest of my stay with my child was awful. I discoveed I was in a room at the top of three incredibly difficult stairways, dragging 30 kg of luggage, and no offer of help from the staff. I shouldn't have to ask - a woman travelling with a small boy and two suitcases is obviously going to need help, but the averted eyes of the staff say it all. When we got to the room eventually, it was terrible. (Unlucky room 313.) Dirty, narrow beds with stains on the sheets. (My son fell off the bed twice in five nights.) Cracked glass in picture, holes in the wall, rust down one side of the cupboard, half-done repainting of walls, stiff windows, nothing to lock up your stuff, and nowhere to put your soap and stuff in the shower. The views of the park: non-existent, because we were stuck in the wqorst room in the hotel. Some rooms don't even seem to have their own showers or toilets, but rather have shared facilities. The staff were, to put it mildly, indifferent, if not rude. At breakfast the first morning a rude blonde lady - the manager I think - demanded my breakfast card and triumphantly let everyone know that I was only having a continental, not full breakfast. When I asked the young waitress what the breakfast included, she couldn't even understand my simple question. Eventually, the manager came back, and was also quite incoherent, so we were really stuck. I asked if we could have boiled eggs, and she said only fried eggs with the English breakfast, even though the next morning there was a bowl of boiled eggs there. I asked if there was cheese available, and she replied a curt "No." The butter bowls are such that customers dig their knives in to take what they need, and then, when finished, the staff simply refill the butter and put it back on the table. Incredibly unhygienic. The second morning we arrived at breakfast at 09h00, and had to grab what we could quickly because half the stuff was being cleared away as soon as possible. I decided I wasn't prepared to put up with these Nazis anymore, and we had three incredibly nice breakfasts at Paddington Station for the rest of the trip. In fact, we avoided the hotel completely doing only the most minimal stuff there. And the other customers seemed to consist mostly of 19 year old loud tourists who made an incredible noise when they returned late at night, and who clogged up the entrance and pavement every morning with no sense of manners. Budget hotel? Yes. Good value for money? A definite "No!" I know this is not goinmg to come out right, but I need to say it directly: the problem in London is that there are far too many foreigners in service jobs who have not been taught basic manners by their employees. They are crude, impolite, curt, impatient, and simply cannot speak simple English. I found the same in many restaurants, stores like Hamleys, and even attractions like Madame Tussaude's. It makes me very sad because this was a once in a lifetime dream trip with my son.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here unless you are desperate!!”
Reviews.Author: leonemoff
Reviews.Content: We needed one night before flying out from London to Hong kong. We wanted to be near the Paddington railway station so as to get to Heathrow easily. What a mistake!! This place was horrible but i guess it could have been worse - dirty as well. It was clean - or at least the linen was (the carpet was disgusting) but that was the only thing going for it. We booked in and were given a room key and told our room number then instructed to go through some doors and down stairs. There are no lifts and we had no clue where to go. Finally i got some help and we ended up in a basement room that was boiling hot, 3 beds jammed in with no room to swing a cat let alone put 3 suitcases anywhere - then the trains started. After an hour or so when we realised we couldnt do this so we went back up the tight stairway, back through 2 buildings to reception. A new person was on the desk and we asked for another room. She offered us a room for 4 people, at no extra charge so we went to check it out before accepting. It was a palace compared to the dungeon - and at no extra charge!! Very strange. Breakfast was terrible - jammed in to tables and chairs where you couldnt move and the food was just toast and a couple of cereals. The place seemed packed with international students - and maybe that is the major focus of this hotel - but if you aren't a backpacker/student DONT GO HERE. And even if you are a backpacker/student you must be able to get cheaper than these prices - cos it wasnt cheap for the dump that it is.

Reviews.Title: “Don't.”
Reviews.Author: ShaneOnHols
Reviews.Content: Checked in 22.30pm, checked out 22.45pm. Â£120 for that? Lesson learned for us - do London hotels properly or make the effort to go home. Young gentleman behind reception very friendly and helpful - sadly the rooms (no air con and camp beds) are poor. Sure you can do worse but this one was not for me.

Reviews.Title: “family advice if you stay with a toddler”
Reviews.Author: Prinsy3 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our weekend in London where we stayed at the Shakespeare Hotel. We were three adults and one child, 17 months (travel cot provided by hotel). On arrival we were booked into a room that had bunk beds and single beds in it and would not know how a travel cot would fit in. Also bunk beds will be a great hazard for your young child climbing all over them. This was on the fourth floor and the stairs were steep and narrow near the top.(Carpets near the top also looked very tired and worn) No lift at the hotel and you would find it very difficult (and tiring) to carry your pram etc upstairs. We were moved to a room on 1st floor that was more suitable (only after expressing concerns over the first room). It was comfortable, however had we paid the Â£170/175 quoted directly by the hotel, we would have felt very ripped off. (Thanks Octopus Travel for your deal) They say breakfast is until 9.00am. Make sure you get there in plenty time to serve yourself, your child and time to eat as by exactly 9.00am everything is cleared away, even the cutlery, so grab what you can when you can. Staff did not appear happy if you had to ask them for something. (Some staff have limited English, which can be a problem if you need something and they don't understand) We had a comfortable night, the hotel was quiet (although can hear people walking in rooms above you), it is in a good location. Reception staff were helpful. Iron didn't work, but didn't bother reporting this. Overall, the room served it's purpose but we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place”
Reviews.Author: donald l
Reviews.Content: i loved it the room was a bit small but who cares the staff was great the food was excelant and the Location even better!! i highly recomended the shakespeare!

Reviews.Title: “It was much better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Hummingbird292 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel clean, efficient, and comfortable for an overnight stay conveniently close to Paddington Station.

Reviews.Title: “Not brilliant, never again”
Reviews.Author: azzap
Reviews.Content: Firstly, they said 24 hour Tea and Coffee facilities, turned out it was a machine, Â£1 per cup, not a kettle. We also had faulty plugs and only had ITV 1&2, and a German TV channel as well as German Nickelodeon. One of the positives was the location, Paddington Station around 130m walk, tube and buses even closer and The Big Bus Tour picked up at the end of the street. Another one was the breakfast, never had a better on site breakfast in London and of course the price, Â£70 per night for four people is not bad but we were expecting more than what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: CzechRepublicKatie10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and it was great. Location is excellent. Its in a quiet square in a nice area called Paddington. There are bus stops just around the corner to take you to Oxford street or Victoria station, and the underground as well, which is very handy. And its only 15min walk to Oxford street. Also, around the corner from the hotel is newsagents shop, gift shop, coffee shops, Burger King and other restaurants. Rooms are quite nice and clean, and you get a breakfast in the morning as well. Staff are very nice and polite, and help you in every way they can. I would really recommend this hotel to anyone who is travelling to London.

Reviews.Title: “Never again, Shakespeare”
Reviews.Author: Roosterman53
Reviews.Content: I unfortunately stayed here for a week at the end of May 2011. The location is great, very handy to everything but that is where it ends. Because I asked for a ground floor room I was put into a 'telephone box' size room. The TV didn't work and after 3 different "maintenance/ techs' staff had a look and couldn;'t fix it I decided to have a go myself and it just needed tuning in. The single bed was rock hard , the window leaked, the toilet flush only worked sometimes, and the hot cold water taps in the shower were reversed. I informed the counter staff that the room was sub standard and 3 days later they gave me another room. The other room looked much better as it had a balcony which was the highpoint of my stay here as it overlooked such a beautiful park. The two single beds were extremely narrow , and hard again and when put together kept drifting apart. Shower was slippery, and the TV remote was broken and when I asked them to either repair it or replace ,I was told bad luck, you only get one. Some of the staff was nice but others didn't seem to care. The breakfasts were very good.............but as I said never again.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bigbub
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with mine and some extended family members, taking up two rooms with 4 younger children and older family members, too. The hotel is clean and well kept, although we found the fast-closing fire doors (slightly weaker springs on the doors, please?) to be a bit irritating. Fortunately we were only on level 1 (not ground!) so we only had a few stairs to manage, but managing heavy bags when there's no lift is not an easy task. We had a great experience with all of the reception staff except for one who chose to cause some problems with us, but the others definitely made up for that experience. They were otherwise very helpful with directions, information on getting around, and otherwise helping however possible. A clean, reasonably sized room, with a refrigerator and hot pot really helped our experience. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Vaughanio
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel as part of a trip to london with young people - it was a reward for a film-making project. This hotel was awful. Not only was it scruffy and smelly but the service was lousy. We ended up in the wrong room with the person at the counter constantly tutting at us - and we even had someone burst into our room when we were sleeping - they had sent them to our room even though there was not a bed available. Breakfast was ok - probably the only bright speck on the horizon.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent newyears eve with these guys!!”
Reviews.Author: proios
Reviews.Content: I went with my family, for business and pleasure. For airport issues, we could fly back home, to Argentina, and everywhere was booked and collapsed! We were lucky in finding this hotel, and we were fantastically treated. Mr Moros and all his crew did everything for us to fell like we were at home. It was difficult for us, because we were in new years eve, and staying in London was not our plan. But we did have a great time, we felt extremely well assisted and the kindness of Mr Moros is not easy to find! So I not only recommend the hotel, but I recommend the people who work at the hotel. I will never forget those days in London, neither my family will. My kids were having fun, my wife was resting and we all were enjoying the hotel. Clean, comfortable, and well located. Finally, I would like to add, that Mr Moros had the gesture of inviting all 4 of us, and share new years eve with his family in his house... I will never forget that night, and specially how cozy they made us fell. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!! thanks so much, George

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: t66alison
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and quiet, good location, there are food shops close by and we had a fridge in the room. The cooked breakfast was really nice and the fresh made waffles were lovely. The staff were friendly and it was nice to be able to leave our bags until our train in the evening. I have stayed in alot of hotels in London, this was one of the better ones.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: CaroleCoco
Reviews.Content: Great people, very clean, quiet and perfect if you are looking for a nice and cheap place! You are quickly close to everything is London. It was my first stay in London and I really enjoyed it, I will get back there the next time in London. Thank you Shakespeare :-)

Reviews.Title: “The usual London rip off”
Reviews.Author: FabioBors
Reviews.Content: Having booked a twin room over the phone I arrived to find that all the twins had gone and only a double was available ! Having explained that my teenage son moves a lot at night I was UPGRADED LOL to a quad room. It was on the fourth floor (no elevater) It smelled of urine. The TV had no chanels or a remote. the furniture looked as if had been recovered from a skip and the water took 8 mins to get warm. I returned to reception to comment on this and a very apethetic lady told me I could have a double instead. Well I have slept in bigger cabins on sail boats than the supposed double. Needless to say I had no sleep as i kept falling of the bed and they managed to turn the heating off all night. I was quoted 85 pounds but it turned out to be plus VAT. I wouldnrt recommend this place to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service”
Reviews.Author: Naini_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in december 2010 and very happy with my stay,Room was beautiful and well-maintained.Breakfast served in the morning was tasty and heavy,Service was excellent and had very good facilities.It is very close to Paddington Station which makes it easy to travel in London.The front office staff is very helpful,helping me with commuting in london and also helped me with touring as a visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: Irishaa
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in an economy hotel in Central London, I recommend the Shakespeare. I also stayed in the dolphin hotel because my flight was cancelled and the staff went out of their way to help me rebook. They were caling the airline for 2 days until I finally secured a seat back home.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like a nuisance”
Reviews.Author: roomwithaview66
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this hotel with a small group of young people. The location is rather elegant, Paddington station just araound the corner. I was pleasantly surprised by the outward appearance but then was treated worse than I could imagine. The towels and sheets were dirty, other people's hairs could still be found on them. I had used one towel for the bathroom floor which I found neatly hung up on a rack in the evening. The hotel had lost our reservation so we had to wait for over an hour until they had their problems sorted out. The receptionist seemed helpless and inadequate and after finally finding rooms for us told us we would have to move again in the morning. In the morning I got a rude phonecall from the reception telling me to come down immediately, she needed to sort out the room problem...Breakfast was ok the first morning, however we had to leave early (7.30pm) the next morning and were only allowed into the breakfast rooms to help ourselves to some hot drinks and some plain biscuits. What a "wonderful" stay. Shakespeare sure would have found some words for it...

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Delibear
Reviews.Content: After 26 hours in transit from Australia, arriving and seeing the room in this hotel brought my daughter and I to tears... The beds sagged, non existent pillow, if you call a pillow case with a rag in it a pillow, and room was very dirty and seedy. My husband managed to squeeze into the bathroom to have a shower, shower head was broken off the wall. When we enquired if someone could fix it, told nobody was available . Asked if they had another room, we were told none were free. Husband went across the road to another hotel to check it out. We checked out of Shakespeare, and miraculously they had another room available. Checked it out was just as bad as the one we left. So, we went and stayed across the road..

Reviews.Title: “very unfair cancellation terms”
Reviews.Author: overoverseas
Reviews.Content: Becareful when you reserve this hotel.My colleague booked this hotel for a short break in london, but she couldnt arrive on time due to the flight reason. she sent cancellation email to this hotel, 72hrs in advance(according to hotel terms), but her credit card has still been charged. Hotel replied that they didnt received the email. After my colleague copied the 'email success sent' record to them, they replied that cancellation would be only recognised if customers have obtained a kind of Code from them. This term is such unfair. it means if they dont send you the Code, you can never cancel the reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Liked This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: happymatraveler
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel cleaner, friendlier and more spruced up from other London hotels with this rating. The breakfast was a full English fryup with other options also available. The convenient location is simply the best with Paddington Station just around the corner and so many small ethic restaurants close by. The parkland is a decided perk. Have booked for next year.

Reviews.Title: “lousy as you can't even imagine”
Reviews.Author: RoDewdrop
Reviews.Content: I normally stay in hostels and cheap places, so I'm ok with almost everything that comes on the way, but this hotel is like the worst place ever. All the staff was very unfriendly, even at breakfast time in the restaurant, waitresses kept looking at each other and laughing at guests. Bedsheets were dirty, not to talk about towels. We asked for them to be changed, we were told by the receptionist to leave them on the floor, I told the housekeeper to please change them, and when we came back, those towels were on the bed, nicely arranged, wet and dirty. When I went downstairs to complain, the receptionist was angry at me because I was making her work, and of course, I never got an apology. The receptionist only gave me two towels, not 4 (we were 4 people), we were told we would have the other 2 on the next morning, which didn't happen, I had to complain again, and when the new receptionist opened the fresh towels bag, one of them was ll dirty, I mean, how is that possible? I booked 4 nights and they made my reservation for just 3, I still don't know why. This trip was my mum's birthday present from my sister and I, so you can imagine how happy we were... Stay at the St David's hotel, which is next door and far better!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected after reading previous reviews”
Reviews.Author: dhp2020
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 3 adults and 3 children looking for a good budget hotel, centrally located. Admittedly, I was concerned after booking because of the reviews that were posted. However, I was pleasently surprised. The exterior building and garden areas were picturesque and the location was perfect for accessing transportation to all of the sights. True, the rooms are small, especially the bath and the beds are just average---but it was clean and we had what was needed for our purposes. The staff was friendly and helpful! Breakfast was included and went above the standard continental fare----again, above my expectations! I think the hotel could benefit from more attention and TLC to their furnishings in the lobby and rooms---but all things take time. It can be noisey at times but so are some of the higher end hotels. I would recommend the hotel to others and would stay again myself. Thanks to the staff for helping make our vacation memorable!

Reviews.Title: “A good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeaEssex
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on this site I was tempted to cancel - I'm so glad I didn't. The hotel is in a lovely square, close to reasonably priced restaurants and the underground and main line station. The staff were really good and our triple bedded en suite room on the third floor was quiet, clean and comfortable, and pretty much what you'd expect from a budget hotel, with few frills but a great location and service to make up for it. Our breakfast was very good and I'm left wondering what the negative reviewers expected for the price. I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Keep looking!”
Reviews.Author: DaijMarbleArch
Reviews.Content: I live locally, but for various reasons just needed a bed for one night. The place was awash with kids running riot, so much so that at 1am in the morning I had to ring down to reception to demand they did something about the shouting and slamming doors. Facilities otherwise couldn't be more basic. No hairdryer, shampoo or tea making facilities etc etc. Also very long climb to my attic room thanks to no lift. If the kids weren't enough to keep you awake, there was also the din from the tube trains which run just behind the hotel. Management must really do better for what is really just a two star dump.

Reviews.Title: “Should be SHUT DOWN”
Reviews.Author: CRAPUk
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a lot of hotel's but this one was a disgrace. I will be writing a letter of complaint to the English Tourist Board . This Hotel should be down rated to a Youth Hostel instead of its current rating (Hotel). The rooms are disgusting, the beds were not made properly, no clean towels, no clean cups for Tea & Coffee. Even the television did not work, you can get better viewing in third world countries. Basic hygiene was ignored and should be reported. There are so many complaints regarding this hotel, I am so disappointed that it is still open. I am aware it is reviewed as a low budget hotel and the website photos look nice but after staying there the pictures on the web are nothing like the hotel at all, they should review this page and change there photos, but then they would not have any guest apart from drunks and certain types of people looking for a room for the night.t All the other hotels on Norfolk Square were much lower in price which would fit the accommodation. We did complain to the Manager, he told us that we could move to another room, but the rooms that he showed us were much worse. The service in this hotel is a total shambles, the best type of guest for this hotel is animals. I think even the animals in London Zoo have better accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: leoElyCambs
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel for theater break in london for two nights with another couple . on arrival reception staff very freindly witch was nice . the room was threadbare, tied , beds old and uncomfortable ,bathroom tiny mouldy , generally a poor unsatisfactory condition for a central london hotel .Its location is ok but next time we will stay further away from the centre to get a nicer cleaner hotel witch dosent have a THAT WILL BE ALRIGHT ,attitude towards ther guests.At best this hotel is no more than 1 star youth hostel and we would not advise any body on a weekend break to london to stay here .ps No tea coffee facilities in room ,we did ask and akettle & cups were brought up THE KETTLE DIDNT WORK say no more.

Reviews.Title: “you can not turn your but, but it was very nice”
Reviews.Author: showercurtain
Reviews.Content: It was a nice low-budget hotel. The rooms were quite small. and the two-person bed was for midgets. the bathroom was very small too. but the positive thing: you could wipe your but with the shower curtain. so don't be surprised when it's a brown spotted curtain. but what can you expect for such a good price? Yes, there was a tv in the room, with one channel. The service of the german ladies was excelent. but every time we went to the reception they asked us if we were checking out. did we smell that bad? But overall we had a very nice stay;-) really

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Bonulo
Reviews.Content: Good beds, good shower. Breakfast scenario quite chaotic at times. Very close to Paddington Station. Only one computer, with a pay-by-the-hour scheme. Slow internet connection. But there's an internet cafÃ© nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Try somewhere else first”
Reviews.Author: AzBoo
Reviews.Content: I didn't book this hotel on purpose. The nearby hotel that I booked had to be shut down for fire exit renovations. They automatically booked me into the Shakespeare and I didn't follow up with any of my own research and just went with it. I stayed a total of 7 nights in two different rooms. First room's advantage was that it was on the first floor. I didn't mind the small accomodations or the noise from the underground. But there was some sort of sewage ventilation problem that caused sewer gases to back up into my toilet closet. I kept the door to it closed and just dealt with it that way. Another problem with this room was the windows did not lock. Bit of a safety/security concern. After traveling around the countryside and returning to London, I again stayed at the Shakespeare for 2 nights. This time my room was on the top floor which meant dragging a heavy suitcase up 5 flights of stairs. I'm a single gal and that was pretty unforgettable. I did it though. Taught me to not do so much shopping or else not travel around the countryside. The room was more bare bones than the first one. No remote for TV either. I never ate the breakfast really. I went downstairs once for it and their idea of fresh fruit was a big bowl of canned fruit cocktail. Yuck. The front desk folks were not very helpful. Their stated check in time is noon on their website. However, if you try to check in at noon they will inform you that it is by prior arrangement only and you have to leave and comeback at 2pm. That is pretty bold. It does seem like a big party place. Not recommended for families, couples, or solo travelers. Only recommended for a bunch of kids that want to party all night. The location is convenient as it is a very short walk from Paddington Station and Underground. That is the ONLY thing this place has going for it.

Reviews.Title: “65% of Reviewers Aren't Wrong.”
Reviews.Author: oneofyoutoo
Reviews.Content: I totally agree with the 65% of reviewers who give this hotel??? the thumbs down. Having spent two of the worst nights I've ever spent in any hotel over the weekend, I'd say to people who regard a clean room as a necessity and fancy more than three hours sleep a night, not to go there. If you're booked in already but haven't gone yet, give some serious thought to switching to another hotel. This place is not a hotel, it's a hostel, pure and simple. The only difference is that instead of a dorm for sleeping, there are individual rooms, although with all the noise at night inside this so-called hotel you'd certainly think you were in the same room as everyone else. I have two bits of advice to anyone thinking about going to London for a break, 1. Stay away from the Shakespeare Hotel, and 2. Stay away from the Shakespeare Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as the previous reviews made it seem like it would be”
Reviews.Author: RedhedMary
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the Shakespeare by a travel agent so didn't have any choice in the matter. Having read the previous reviews, the three of us were prepared to be less than impressed. While it wasn't fancy, we did have three decent beds (a double and a single) in a clean but not fancy room. There was an attached bathroom with shower, sink, and toilet. Things were a bit threadbare but nothing dangerous or unclean. We ate breakfast in the basement restaurant - a bit plain but it fed us. The staff at the desk were quite friendly to us. Location was great - within a block of Paddington station made it easy to go wherever we wanted in the city. Not the best place I've ever stayed but certainly not the worst by any means. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for reasonable budget accommodations. There were lots of young students staying in the hotel, they were a bit loud in the evening but tolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't leave fast enough”
Reviews.Author: Ottawa_valley_girl2
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was small and the furniture was threadbare. The tiny shower room (7ft x3ft) was smelly, musty and mouldy. My family stayed here only because the hotel we originally booked "had water damage" and booked us across the street at the Shakespeare. The desk staff were helpful in giveng directions. Breakfast was just ok. Typically for the UK, the coffee was undrinkable.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Annie_79_8
Reviews.Content: Only select this hotel if you like mould, noise, dirt everywhere and old, damaged furniture. The staff was extremely unfriendly - some did not even speak English. This is more a youth hostel than a hotel. The guests and the tube running just behind the hotel are extremely noisy, so do not expect silent nights. The bathroom was so tiny that you couldn't even close the door behind you when you were standing in front of the washbasin. The toilet and shower were also in a very poor state. In the kitchen they have a plate on the wall: "Customer says: my money pays your wages!" No further comment! I liked the situation though. Paddington is not a very nice quarter, but there are a lot of nice little shops and the tube station at only 3 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Should have read the reviews :(”
Reviews.Author: kelownachris
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to London, actually the first trip to the European continent itself. I had heard that London was extremely expensive and tried to find a modestly priced hotel in London. I would have liked to have stayed at a chain-type of hotel like the Sheraton, etc., but could not afford it. So I picked a hotel that I thought was priced fairly and near a tube station so that I could move about the city and see some sights. I was only staying one night as I was catching a plane in the morning to another country. I thought, "how bad can it be, as I am only going to SLEEP there, right?" I have to say that I was disappointed. I found that their internet site raved about how good the hotel was and showed a photograph of a very nice "lobby?". I don't think the lobby in the photo is actually in this hotel as I never saw it. The outside of the hotel looked extremely nice and it is in a very quaint neighbourhood, close to amenities and just around the corner from Paddington Station, which was great. There are no elevators, so I had to carry two extremely heavy bags totaling about 50kg up three flights of stairs to our room. I didn't like the idea of a shared bathroom but I thought that this was the norm in London. The bathroom was on the second floor so I had to walk to it in the middle of the night. Very bland and scary bathroom. The room itself was very bare, just two beds and an armoire-type thing that had a television. Extremely tiny room with not much room to move around in. This hotel was so nasty that on my return trip through London I chose another hotel, thinking it would have to be a better experience. Oh well, that is another review. The continental breakfast was okay, a typical english breakfast, but the dining area seemed to be located in the sub-basement, a bit of a bad location. Stay away from this hotel, I felt I was "taken" by the advertising on their official webpage. Obviously that is was marketing and a keen web-designer is paid to do.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: DorothyDenmark
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I read the previous reviews about this hotel and thought "how bad can it be". Believe me it is BAD. I had asked for a single room with bathroom. My room was behind the reception area. There was a shower cubicle in the room. The toilet was in another room with a lock on the door in case anyone else tried to use it! I traveled with a friend whose room was on the third floor. Her toilet was shared with others on the floor below! The London Underground is underneath and every time a train passed, my floor was shaking. I have stayed in 2 other budget hotels before in London so I am used to low quality hotels but this is the absolute worst. The only good thing was the staff. They were friendly and always smiling. We chose this hotel due to its location. But there are plenty of other hotels in the Bayswater/Paddington area to choose from. Never again Shakespeare Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Youth Hostel, not a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Eimeyg
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend booked this for a long weekend with our mothers. We got a pretty good rate for a "family" (quad) room, so were prepared for it to be basic enough - but not this bad. There were three single beds and a set of bunk beds(!) with about a foot of space between them. The "en suite" was not fit for use by anyone above a size 8 and was mildewy and not very clean. The windows would not stay open, the curtains had cigarette burns all over them, as did the carpet. The room was cold all the time, even though it was sweltering outside. We were on the top floor - (4th i think, not sure) - and beside what was obviously a large dorm room with about 6 students in it, who partied hard every night in their room. Complaints about the noise were met with abuse by the culprits and indifference by the management. There were only 2 towels provided and when we asked on the third night of our stay for additional towels we were given 2 hand towels and told that was all they were allowed give us. When we expressed dissatisfaction at the standard of the hotel - we were told that "it is only 2 star, what did you expect?" This place is no more than a (bad) youth hostel and should not even have 2 stars!! Stay away is my advice, there are much nicer small hotels (and much better hostels!) in London who will treat you better.

Reviews.Title: “Old and dingy dorm-like atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: travel_neophyte
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 3-night stay at the Shakespeare Hotel last week. It was probably the worst hotel experience I've had. Our room was old, dark, dingy, and smelled musty. Bathroom ceiling had mold growing on it, tiny shower stall was mildewed. Every few minutes, the room vibrated from trains passing by. Noise compounded by loud students upstairs. We paid $150/night; unsure if hotels at that rate are in similar condition but I highly recommend NOT staying at this hotel if you can help it.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: wickedchicken
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, -just 2 minutes walk to paddington station and a few stops the leiscter square. The area is safe, but not much going on with regards to pubs, restaurants etc. The hotel is BASIC! tiny room, holes in the floor under the carpet....you get what you pay for, but really its not the worst. however i dont think id stay there again-we had friends staying around the corner at the alexandra hotel and it was definately nicer-cleaner and brighter.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy Shakespeare?”
Reviews.Author: dudditsSSDD
Reviews.Content: We spent almost two weeks in this summer in this hotel. We had a low budget and were not suprised what we got. The bed sheets were replaced only once in our 11 nights visit, but new towels were brought every day, even though we hadn`t even used the old ones yet. The room wasnÂ´t vacuumed even once during our visit. Otherwise the little room was ok. There were some quite noisy german students and the sub went straight under the hotel, trains going every five to ten minutes. It didn`t disturb us though, being so tired after whole days marches trought London... Service is good and the stuff is friendly and helpful. Safetybox didnÂ´t cost a penny.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: mick0214
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in Feb 2006 in a family room which consisted of a double and a single bed.Room had a trouser press,fridge,table,2 chairs,television and en-suite facilities.Ensuite was clean with plenty of towels and toilet paper provided.Asked for more pillows which were provided.Bedspread covers were dirty.Walls are paper thin so you will hear lots of noise from other rooms and also all floorboards creak. Continental breakfast consisted of cereal, juice,coffee/tea,toast,boiled eggs. Internet facilities available in lobby along with pool table and coke machine.Hotel reception has a safe available at no cost for guest use. Hotel location is the best thing about this place as its near Paddington Station for tube and buses...bus 15 will bring you from here as far as Tower Bridge via Oxford St, Regent St, Trafalgar Sq, St Pauls Cathedral and also back to here.Good value restaurants and pubs locally and seems to be a safe place.

HotelInfo.Name: Shakespeare Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 22-28 Norfolk Square, London W2 1RS, England
